sense.name: a period of intense activity
sense.examples: They used to go on a lot of drinking bouts during their college years. Mary does occasional bouts of strenuous exercise. Last week we had a bout of thunderstorms.

sense.name: a period of illness
sense.commentary: BOUT[+expanse][+temporal][+period][+illness] Note: always implies an ailment of a subject.
sense.examples: She had a severe bout of flu last winter. He's already had two bouts of prostate cancer. Is her mother still having bouts of dizzy spells?

sense.name: a fighting match
sense.examples: His dream was to have a bout with the heavy-weight champion of the world. We watched some wrestling bouts on television.

sense.name: curved side of a musical stringed instrument
sense.examples: A violin has an hourglass shape formed by an upper bout and a lower bout. It's a large guitar with a 16-inch lower bout.
